image.altText: a blonde woman wearing glasses, a hard hat and a high-vis vest.

props.synopsis: Jacinta Allan has emerged from a Victorian Labor caucus meeting as the premier-elect, after long-time leader Daniel Andrews announced he was calling time on the job after nine years.

title.children: Jacinta Allan fends off late challenge to become 49th premier of Victoria

image.altText: Close-up of man

props.synopsis: Court hears the Office of the Special Investigator won't be given access to statements of people compelled to give evidence during the veteran's defamation battle.

title.children: War crimes investigators denied access to all evidence from Ben Roberts-Smith defamation trial

image.altText: Woman coughing or sneezing into her elbow at her desk with laptop in front of her

props.synopsis: There aren't any vaccines for or anti-viral drugs to treat human metapneumovirus (HMPV), but experts say there's no need to be alarmed.

title.children: Have you been sick lately? It might be this virus you 'probably don't know about'

image.altText: Goyder sits, partly obscured.

props.synopsis: Qantas faces off against senators in a parliamentary hearing, as its chair Richard Goyder defies shareholder calls to stand down.

title.children: Qantas board chair says his future remains tenable, as the airline faces a grilling from senators

image.altText: Noel Pearson by AAP Lukas Coch

props.synopsis: Leading Yes campaigner and Indigenous academic Noel Pearson has made an impassioned speech to the National Press Club pleading for Australians to support the Voice to Parliament.

title.children: 'Only love can move us now': Noel Pearson uses Voice as call for national unity

image.altText: A number of adults in protective headgear, surround a boy in a padded room preparing to grab him. All faces are blurred.

props.synopsis: The minister for the NDIS says an investigation may be needed following a Four Corners story that revealed children continued to be secluded in small, windowless rooms at a controversial autism service in Melbourne.

title.children: Bill Shorten 'perplexed' by controversial practices continued at Melbourne autism service

image.altText: Rescued Green Tree snake on fence

props.synopsis: Snake catchers say it is becoming harder to find new homes for the reptiles as urban areas expand and the weather warms up.

title.children: 'They're bigger and nastier': Warmer weather brings bumper start to snake season

image.altText: Person's hand with blue nailpolish design holding onto the pill

props.synopsis: From today many women across New South Wales will no longer have to go to their GP every time they need a new script for the oral contraceptive pill. Here's how the expanded trial will work.

title.children: It's just been made easier in NSW to access the contraceptive pill. This is what's changing

image.altText: A young man and young woman and baby  look at the camera unsmiling and baby

props.synopsis: A "sunset date" has been used to cancel the contracts of 47 would-be homeowners on New South Wales' North Coast, who say they have now been priced out of the market.

title.children: This young couple signed a contract three years ago to buy land but the developer has pulled the pin

image.altText: x-ray of duck laid out wings spread arrow imbedded in rear right side deep all the way into near it's left thigh bone

props.synopsis: Animal advocates say they are seeing more cruelty cases involving wildlife, as a researcher warns of an association between animal abuse and other violent crimes.

title.children: Ducks shot with arrows, brush turkeys spray-painted as vets warn cruelty to wild animals rising

image.altText: Two young people walk through a train station wearing face masks.

props.synopsis: COVID-19 became one of Australia's leading causes of death in 2022, data from the Bureau of Statistics shows, however heart disease remained the biggest killer.

title.children: For the first time in over 50 years, an infectious disease is a leading cause of death in Australia

image.altText: Nick Sallese and Margate road sign.

props.synopsis: A casual conversation at a tip-shop in Tasmania's south almost 15 years ago between a man not seen since 2008 and an acquaintance could be the missing clue a family has been desperately waiting for, the man's son says.

title.children: Nick has been missing for 15 years — a phone call has given his family new reason for hope

image.altText: A person walks past the PwC welcome sign inside a building.

props.synopsis: An independent review into governance, culture and accountability at consulting giant PwC has singled out the "excessive power" of the firm's chief executive and poor practices which went "unexamined and uncorrected" for years.

title.children: A scathing review into PwC's culture unearths a 'whatever it takes' attitude that resulted in 'integrity failures'

image.altText: A drone image of a railway line under construction, with paddocks either side.

props.synopsis: Work on the multi-billion-dollar Inland Rail project slows significantly in Queensland, as an advocate warns the finished track may only stretch as far north as the state's border with New South Wales.

title.children: 'Father' of Inland Rail project from Melbourne to Brisbane warns line may never reach Toowoomba

image.altText: A man demonstrates CPR on a plastic dummy to a group of men in a room

props.synopsis: Misbah Islam said "no way" when paramedics told him he was having a heart attack but they were soon bringing him back from the brink of death. He wants more people to know the basics of saving a life.

title.children: Islamic doctors hope to smash 'bystander hesitancy' with mosque first aid sessions

image.altText: a composite picture of a rural landscape overlaid with a map of the NSW coast, with a inset picture of a 10-storey high house

props.synopsis: With home gym, rooftop spa, indoor swimming pool and whole-floor tennis court, this 10-storey, single family residence would look at home among the apartment towers of the Gold Coast.

title.children: Is this Australia's tallest house? This 10-storey rural monolith comes with a suspended observation deck

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair and a black jumper looks at the camera with a neutral expression

props.synopsis: A speech pathologist says Irabina Autism Services in Melbourne was running controversial practices as late as February last year.

title.children: Anica has seen a lot in her job, but this experience left her 'physically shaking'

image.altText: Trump grimaces as he speaks at a rally outside in the hot sun, with sweat visible on his face.

props.synopsis: A judge rules that Donald Trump committed fraud for years while building the real estate empire that catapulted him to fame and the White House.

title.children: Donald Trump defrauded banks for years, New York civil case rules

image.altText: Closeup of a plane with a red kangaroo symbol, the Qantas logo

props.synopsis: KPMG's boss tells a Senate inquiry it's reviewing its donations process, PwC's internal bombshell drops, inflation is heating up again, and Qantas is facing a serious grilling by another inquiry.

title.children: Qantas grilled by Senate inquiry, as consulting firms KPMG and PwC face more heat

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: The chair of Qantas has told the senators he should remain as head of the board to maintain continuity at the airline, as the tenability of his position is challenged. "The feedback I got from our major shareholders was they want the continuity of leadership of me as chair of the board, particularly with a new CEO," Mr Goyder told the inquiry. "While I retain the confidence of our shareholders and the board I will continue to serve." More on that here.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Qantas chairman stands by his decision to stay

featuredLink.title: Qantas board chair says his future remains tenable, as the airline faces a grilling from senators

children.content: The chair of Qantas has told the senators he should remain as head of the board to maintain continuity at the airline, as the tenability of his position is challenged.
"The feedback I got from our major shareholders was they want the continuity of leadership of me as chair of the board, particularly with a new CEO," Mr Goyder told the inquiry.
"While I retain the confidence of our shareholders and the board I will continue to serve."
More on that here.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Australian shares fell in broad-based sell off on Wednesday, tracking declines in global equities as fears of higher-for-longer interest rates kept risk sentiment in check, with inflation jumps again in Australia. The ASX 200 fell 0.1 per cent to 7,030. The annual rate of inflation picked up in August, to 5.2 per cent from 4.9 per cent, according to the latest monthly measure of inflation, with this pushed up by more expensive housing, transport, food and insurance. Markets globally continued to digest last week's indication from the US Federal Reserve that it would keep rates higher for longer than investors had previously expected. Back home, gold stocks fell 2 per cent to a more than one-month low as bullion retreated overnight. On the benchmark index, sector majors Newcrest Mining and Northern Star Resources fell 2 per cent and 2.4 per cent, respectively. Healthcare stocks also retreated 0.7 per cent with biotech major CSL falling 1.4 per cent. Rate-sensitive financial stocks held up well, gaining 0.1 per cent. Technology stocks tracked Wall Street losses to slide nearly 1 per cent, and energy stocks also fell 0.4 per cent. Star Entertainment topped losses on the benchmark index, falling almost 10 per cent to hit its all-time low. The stock resumed trading after completing a discounted $750 million equity raising. The mining sector (-0.1pc) also finished the day in the red. Here are the top and bottom movers of the day.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: ASX closed down

children.content: Australian shares fell in broad-based sell off on Wednesday, tracking declines in global equities as fears of higher-for-longer interest rates kept risk sentiment in check, with inflation jumps again in Australia.
The ASX 200 fell 0.1 per cent to 7,030.
The annual rate of
inflation picked up in August
, to 5.2 per cent from 4.9 per cent, according to the latest monthly measure of inflation, with this pushed up by more expensive housing, transport, food and insurance.
Markets globally continued to digest last week's indication from the US Federal Reserve that it would keep rates higher for longer than investors had previously expected.
Back home, gold stocks
fell 2 per cent to a more than one-month low as bullion retreated overnight.
On the benchmark index, sector majors Newcrest Mining and Northern Star Resources fell 2 per cent and 2.4 per cent, respectively.
Healthcare stocks also retreated 0.7 per cent with biotech major CSL falling 1.4 per cent.
Rate-sensitive financial stocks held up well, gaining 0.1 per cent.
Technology stocks
tracked Wall Street losses to slide nearly 1 per cent, and energy stocks also fell 0.4 per cent.
Star Entertainment
topped losses on the benchmark index, falling almost 10 per cent to hit its all-time low. The stock resumed trading after completing a discounted $750 million equity raising.
The mining sector (-0.1pc) also finished the day in the red.
Here are the top and bottom movers of the day.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Senator Tony Sheldon is asking for "genuine contrition" from Qantas over its many documented problems. Which its chairman Richard Goyder says they do. That's as he faces calls to resign.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Qantas says they have 'genuine contrition'

featuredLink.title: Qantas shareholders demand Richard Goyder quit as chairman as 'more things come to light' about management decisions

children.content: Senator Tony Sheldon is asking for "genuine
contrition" from Qantas over its many documented problems.
Which its chairman Richard Goyder says they do.
That's as he faces calls to resign.

image.altText: Apartments being built.

props.synopsis: A new model of housing development is being touted as a solution to the housing crisis. But is it a game changer or more of the same for renters across New South Wales?

title.children: Build-to-rent housing is gaining momentum, so will it help ease the rental crisis?

image.altText: Winner of "Dash for Cash" was Come By Chance farmer Charlie Friend

props.synopsis: A race club that staged a successful stockhorse event on the weekend in a town immortalised in verse by Banjo Patterson faces an investigation by the state's thoroughbred racing regulator.

title.children: Come By Chance 'Dash for Cash' event under investigation by Racing NSW

image.altText: A man walks on the street holding a plastic bag, which contains a bag of ice.

props.synopsis: Supermarket chain Drakes, which operates more than 60 stores in South Australia and Queensland, is introducing Afterpay as a means of payment — but the move has prompted a warning from a social welfare group, which says it could contribute to spiralling debt.

title.children: Supermarket chain's Afterpay deal triggers 'debt trap' concern from welfare group

image.altText: man in bed smiling

props.synopsis: A friend of critically ill surfing great Mark Richardson says his situation has become so dire that medical evacuation is his only chance of survival.

title.children: Surfing great to be evacuated to Australia as friend warns 'he'll die if he stays'

image.altText: Paul Burnham wearing Australia jacket

props.synopsis: The distinctive jacket worn by Bob Hawke when he celebrated Australia's upset win of the America's Cup in 1983 was, in fact, designed by a 23-year-old architecture student to parody nationalistic fervour.

title.children: Designer reveals the irony stitched into 'silly' Australia jacket made famous by Bob Hawke in 1983

image.altText: Picketers hold signs saying writers guild of america on strike in front of paramount pictures gate

props.synopsis: Leaders of the screenwriters' union say their nearly five-month strike will finish, bringing Hollywood partly back from a historic halt in production.

title.children: Hollywood writers strike to end after guild leaders approve deal with studios

image.altText: Two women, one in her 30s and another in her 70s, smiling while on a stage under lights

props.synopsis: Zoleka Mandela's life was tangled with tragedy, addiction and redemption, ultimately becoming a champion for those living with cancer and people who had lost children.

title.children: Zoleka Mandela, granddaughter of Nelson Mandela, dies aged 43

image.altText: Matt Raos during the inquiry sitting in front of a little microphone.

props.synopsis: Qatar Airways says the strip search was currently before the Federal Court so could not comment extensively but provided "assurance" that the incident was a "one off".

title.children: Qatar Airways says invasive strip search of female passengers was a 'one off'

image.altText: White woman with curled blonde hair wears blue chrome armor and red cape, while blonde man wears the same in background.

props.synopsis: The screen industry funding cut, affecting high-end television and blockbuster film productions, was confirmed in the state budget last week.

title.children: NSW government reinstates $60m funding to film and television industry a week after budget cut

image.altText: A man in an orange emergency uniform picks up a brick on the top of a pile of rubble.

props.synopsis: More than 100 people are dead and 150 injured in a fire at a wedding celebration in the district of Hamdaniya in Iraq's Nineveh province, Iraqi state media reports.

title.children: More than 100 killed, 150 injured in fire at Iraq wedding party

image.altText: an aerial shot of three beachfront highrise towers on the Gold Coast

props.synopsis: The Jewel's eye-catching towers are the sparkling gem in the Surfers Paradise skyline, but three years after they were built, hundreds of luxury apartments remain empty and most are not up for sale.

title.children: The curious case of the Jewel and the Gold Coast's near-empty $1.5b towers

image.altText: school children playing handball in red and yellow uniforms

props.synopsis: A primary school vice-captain has fulfilled her election promise by organising the "Best. Day. Ever". But how do you settle rule disputes?

title.children: Do you know the rules of handball? These kids do

image.altText: acrobats in silhouette with some performers in the air with orange background

props.synopsis: Contemporary circus in Australia has been left reeling as Swinburne University pauses the 2024 intake for NICA's circus arts degree.

title.children: 'Why would we trash a national treasure?' Future of Australia's only tertiary circus school in doubt
